definition[0]: a wild animal like a dog with reddish-brown fur, a pointed face, and a thick tail
definition[1]: someone who is clever and good at deceiving people
example[0]: He was a sly old fox.
definition[2]: the skin and fur of a fox, used to make clothes
definition[4]: to be too difficult for someone to do or understand
example[1]: We were foxed by the problem.
definition[5]: to confuse or deceive someone in a clever way
definition[6]: one of the main national television networks in the US. The others include ABC, CBS, and NBC. Fox is the newest of the main US television networks, and is part of Rupert Murdoch's company, News Corporation.
